      • SetChanged

        public static void SetChanged(IConfigurable conf)
        Notifies the Sorter/Filter/Grouper that it has been changed. You should do this after changing values in a Sorter/Grouper/Filter so that the item can update it's state.
        Parameters:
        conf -

      • SetChanged

        public static void SetChanged(ViewFolder view)
        Notifies the View that it has been changed. You should do this after chaning sort/filter/grouper values to allow the view to update itself with the new information.
        Parameters:
        view -

      • Refresh

        public static void Refresh(ViewFolder view)
        Forces a view to refresh itself on the call to GetChildren. Normally GetChildren() results are cached, so if you change the view state then you should call refresh()
        Parameters:
        view -

      • SetFilter

        Sets a filter on a view. If there is an existing filter with the same name, then it is removed, and the new one is added.

      • HasHint

        public static boolean HasHint(java.lang.String hint,
                              ViewFolder folder)
        Checks if a given view folder has a 'hint'. When configuring 'presentation' levels you can set hints, like, 'series' that can later be checked to see if a given view folder has that hint. In the case of a 'series' hint, you may want to have the display fetch 'banners' since you know the data in the view folder is 'series' data.
        Parameters:
        hint -
        folder -
        Returns:

      • HasTag

        public static boolean HasTag(java.lang.String tag,
                             ViewFolder folder)
        Returns true if the given view have the specified tag. Tags differ from hints, since hints can be different for each presentation level whereas tags are applied globally. ie, a view factory that is tagged with 'tv' will make the 'tv' tag available to children, but it cannot be changed at each presentation level.
        Parameters:
        tag -
        folder -
        Returns:

      • HasTag

        public static boolean HasTag(IConfigurable configurable,
                             java.lang.String tag)
        Returns true if the given IConfigurable, ie, (Sorter, Filter, Grouper) has the specified tag.
        Parameters:
        tag -
        configurable - IConfigurable instance
        Returns:

      • DeleteItem

        public static boolean DeleteItem(IMediaResource res,
                                 boolean withoutPrejudice)
        Physically deletes a file and removes it from its parent.

        withoutPrejudice is a flag to tell sage tv that this item is being deleted as a result of an incorrect recording, etc, so that intelligent recordings can function correctly.

        Parameters:
        res -
        withoutPrejudice -

      • SetVisible

        public static void SetVisible(ViewFactory item,
                              boolean vis)
        This sets/removes a hidden flag to views's UserRecord, to indicate that the user is hiding the view.

        Use this API to set the hidden flag for the view outside the Xml.

        Parameters:
        item -

      • IsLoaded

        public static boolean IsLoaded(IMediaFolder folder,
                               int itemout)
        Returns true if the folder is loaded, or loads before the timeout specified. If a the folder is loaded, then it returns immediately, but if it is not loaded, then it will when it is loaded, but it won't wait longer than the timeout.
        Parameters:
        itemout -

      • IsOnlineFolder

        public static boolean IsOnlineFolder(IMediaFolder folder)
        Returns true if the folder is an Online Media folder. The UI may want to choose to display Online Folders differently, since they load asychronously.
        Parameters:
        folder -
        Returns:

      • GetView

        public static ViewFolder GetView(java.lang.Object folder)
        Safe way to get a ViewFolder from anothe object. Probably never needs to be called externally, but it is used internally to ensure that the object being acted upon is a view folder
        Parameters:
        folder - ViewFolder or IMediaFolder instance
        Returns:
        ViewFolder or null if the Object is not a ViewFolder or cannot be turned into a ViewFolder

      • GetSageMediaFiles

        public static IMediaFolder GetSageMediaFiles(java.lang.String mediaMask,
                                             java.lang.String label)
        Given the SageTV media mask, return the resulting media items as a folder. The media mask is defined in the sagetv api for GetMediaFiles(mediaMask), but basically, "B" - bluray, "D" - DVD, "T" - TV, "V" videos, "M" - music, "P" pictures, "L" - library.

        Internal Use

        Parameters:
        mediaMask -
        label -
        Returns:

      • Play

        public static boolean Play(java.lang.Object file,
                           java.lang.String uiContext)
        Given an object, try to play it. If the object is a Sage MediaFile, then it will be played as is. If the object is a IMediaFile then it will be played as a regular media item. If the object is a IMediaFolder (ie, maybe a grouped folder), then it will be played as a Playlist.

        Although it's not implemented yet, but if you pass a url, then the API will eventually start to download the url media object and then begin to play it. Currently, it does not do this.

        THIS IS FOR MY OWN REFERENCE Keyboard shortcuts... F5 = Page Up F6 = Page Down F7 = Page Left F8 = Page Right {Up} = Up {Down} = Down {Left} = Left {Right}=Right {Home} = Home/Main Menu {PageUp} = Channel Up/Page Up {PageDown} = Channel Down/Page Down {ctrl} left arrow = Left/Volume Down {ctrl} right arrow = Right/Volume Up {ctrl} up arrow = Up/Channel Up {ctrl} down arrow = Down/Channel Down {ctrl} A Skip Bkwd/Page Left {ctrl} D Play {ctrl} E Volume Down {ctrl} F = Skip Fwd/Page Right {ctrl} G = Time Scroll {ctrl} I = Info {ctrl} J = Don't Like {ctrl} K = Favorite {ctrl} M = Play Faster {ctrl} N = Play Slower {ctrl} O = Options {ctrl} R = Volume Up {ctrl} S = Pause {ctrl} V = TV {ctrl} w = Watched {ctrl} X = Guide {ctrl} Y = Record {ctrl} Z = Power {ctrl}{shift} F = Full Screen/Windows Screen {ctrl}{shift} S = Play/Pause {ctrl}{shift} M = Mute {pause] = Pause {alt}F4 = Exit/Close Program

        CTRL+G seems to do a STOP

        Parameters:
        file - - Sage MediaFile, IMediaFile, IMediaFolder or url.
        uiContext -

      • CreateView

        public static ViewFolder CreateView(java.lang.String view,
                                    java.lang.Object options)
        Create a new ViewFolder containing the files from view. A view contains one or more Sources that are grouped, filtered, sorted, etc.

        ViewFolders, while instances of IMediaFolder are different in that they can "Operations" applied to them, such as Filtering, Sorting, and Grouping.

        Parameters:
        view - Factory id of the IMediaFolder view factory
        options - either a Map of name value pairs or a string in json map format (ie, name: "value", name2: "value )
        Returns:
        ViewFolder instance

      • IsPlayable

        public static boolean IsPlayable(java.lang.Object file)
        Return true if the file can be handled by PlayMediaFile(). This call is handy to use when you are rendering the media resources, since some media resources, such as grouped resources can be played as a single item.
        Parameters:
        media - resource (file, folder, sage object)
        Returns:

      • ReloadViews
